#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=For small parties , the states where they run has very little to do with where they have the most support and very much to do with which states have the easiest regulations .
#Text=( ( WS ) ) What issues or policy stances form the basis of your campaign ?

#Text=( ( JH ) ) Inasmuch as beverage alcohol is our signature issue , I anticipate spending most of my time talking about the alcohol connection with various social problems : public safety , public health , taxes , homelessness , spouse abuse , child welfare , military preparedness , industrial efficiency , product quality , and so forth .
#Text=The platform most likely will address a lot of other things , but , let ’s face it : The Prohibition
#Text=Party today is an exercise in living history .
#Text=We ’re like the weekend warriors who put on costumes and re-enact the Civil War .
#Text=The South is not going to rise again .
#Text=Neither is national prohibition going to come back ( not , at least , in our lifetimes ) .
#Text=But in both cases , we think there are important historical lessons which ought not be forgotten .
#Text=And so , we soldier on against all odds .
#Text=Unless we stay on the message ( of alcohol ) , our living history lesson will be lost .
#Text=( ( WS ) ) Have you received any notable endorsements thus far ?
#Text=( ( JH ) ) No. Neither have I sought any .

#Text=( ( WS ) ) According to Weekend America , Vice-Presidential nominee Leroy Pletten was incapacitated following a stroke during the 2008 campaign . Have you chosen a running mate , and if not , will health be a factor in the decision ?
#Text=( ( JH ) ) The Public Radio announcement appears to be a case of mistaken identity .
#Text=I have checked with Pletten , and no such thing happened .
#Text=I ’ve been asking around .
#Text=I know who I ’d like to have , but it ’s still under discussion .
#Text=Health should enter into it .
#Text=We do n’t need another Reagan !
#Text=( ( WS ) ) How often do you campaign , and how might that change should you win the nomination ?
#Text=( ( JH ) ) Very little campaigning , at this point .
#Text=I sent out a series of monthly postcards last year , presenting myself to the people on the Party mailing list .
#Text=There is also a ( very rudimentary ) campaign website – www.hedges4-12.com I ’m in touch with the people who will make the decision , at the Convention this coming June .
#Text=If I should receive the nomination , the website will have to be improved , and there will have to be press releases and some personal visits to states where we get on the ballot .
#Text=I ’ll have to obtain advice on making more effective use of the internet .
#Text=( ( WS ) ) Describe a typical day for Jim Hedges . How do you spend your time ?
#Text=( ( JH ) ) Before going to sleep each evening , I map out the following day in my mind .

#Text=Then , in the morning , I roll out ( not too early ) , tend to personal care and a hearty breakfast , go to the other house ( when my wife and I were married , 20 years ago , we each had a paid-for house , and it was convenient to keep both of them ) and tend to the pets .
#Text=The rest of the morning is spent dealing with paper mail and other clerical work .
#Text=In warm weather , afternoons are devoted to yard work and to gardening ; in cold weather , I do household maintenance chores , work in the shop , work on the wood pile .
#Text=After supper , if there is not a rehearsal or a concert to go to , I practice half an hour on my tuba , then look at the internet or read .
